channel.title: Newbie Scripter Looking for Mentor
channel.description:
Well I just found out about this whole SCAR thing about 2 hours ago, and I must say it is interesting. Ever since I started playing RuneScape I wondered how to make scripts that would allow me to sit back and watch my computer play for me. I tried all sorts of nasty scripting languages, but either they couldn't accomplish what I wanted to, or Microsoft wanted to suck even more money from me for developing in the lang.
So anyway, the boring stuff is now aside. What I am asking is for someone who has made plenty of RuneScape SCAR scripts to help me learn how to also. I am on alot, willing to learn, willing to work, and know some computer programming skills. I guess the lessons could be held over email, since it seems that scar scripts can be shown in simple *.txt format.
If you are interested, just leave a reply here, and we can hammer out all of the extra details. So please somebody, help me learn the tools of the trade from a master.
[size=7pt]And by the way, this is my first post here, so sorry if I didn't put this in the correct section.[/size]

item.title: Newbie Scripter Looking for Mentor
item.dc:creator: @milkyway100 frostbyte100
item.description:
@milkyway100 wrote:

id be happy to teach you over msn or something when im not busy

Read full topic

item.title: Newbie Scripter Looking for Mentor
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[quote=“KyleGut3, post:8, topic:4883”]Actually its

ClickMouse(x,y,true);
wait(10);
ClickMouse(x,y,true);

Its good to see cheezy trying to help

Keep up the good work.[/quote]

Thanks, I do what I can do.
Ya, that script took a lot of testing.

Read full topic

item.title: Newbie Scripter Looking for Mentor
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[quote=“RdSoxFan618, post:6, topic:4883”][quote author=lilshu link=topic=6368.msg64490#msg64490 date=1152834123]
OK, and believe me, there will be ALOT of questions.

Anyway, I am proud of myself, I found out how to make the mouse double click in a position.
[/quote]

MouseClick(x,y)
wait(100)
MouseClick(x,y)[/quote]

It’s actually:

ClickMouse(x,y); wait(10); ClickMouse(x,y);

Good to see newer people trying to help.

Keep up the good work.

Read full topic
